news.title: OpenAI buys tiny health records startup Torch for, reportedly, $100M
news.summary: AI health records startup Torch will be using its tech for OpenAI's new ChatGPT Health, according to co-founder Ilya Abyzov.

news.title: Hands-on with Bee, Amazon’s latest AI wearable
news.summary: We tried Amazon's new AI wearable Bee. It's not for pro users yet, but more features are expected this year.

news.title: Why Amazon bought Bee, an AI wearable
news.summary: Amazon explains where its wearable Bee fits in and whether it will merge with Alexa.

news.title: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta is launching its own AI infrastructure initiative
news.summary: Meta is ramping up its efforts to build out its AI capacity — Zuckerberg said the company intended to drastically expand its energy footprint in the coming years.

news.title: Anthropic announces Claude for Healthcare following OpenAI’s ChatGPT Health reveal
news.summary: Anthropic's Claude for Healthcare is unveiled about a week after OpenAI announced its ChatGPT Health product.

news.title: The best robot vacuums we’ve tested for 2026
news.summary: Robot vacuums are impressive devices that will clean your floors well and — thanks to bigger batteries and better robot brains — rarely get tired of doing their job. news.title: Fired Rockstar employees’ plea for interim pay denied
news.summary: A UK employment tribunal rejected a request from fired Rockstar Games employees to receive interim pay while waiting for a full hearing about their dismissal, according to Bloomberg and IGN. news.title: Framework hikes desktop PC prices as RAM shortage drags on
news.summary: Just weeks after raising the price of its RAM modules, Framework has announced that it's also increasing the price of its desktop PC in response to the global memory shortage. news.title: Meta plans to lay off hundreds of metaverse employees this week
news.summary: Meta's Reality Labs team is expected to lose around 10 percent of its staff, with layoffs concentrated on the division's metaverse employees, as reported by The New York Times. news.summary: FCC waives rule that forced Verizon to unlock phones 60 days after activation.

news.title: New Proposed Legislation Would Let Self-Driving Cars Operate in New York State
news.summary: New York governor Kathy Hochul says she will propose a new law allowing limited autonomous vehicle pilots in smaller cities. Full-blown services could be next.

news.title: Minnesota Sues to Stop ICE ‘Invasion’
news.summary: The state of Minnesota, along with the Twin Cities, have sued the US government and several officials to halt the flood of agents carrying out an Immigration and Customs Enforcement operation.

news.title: FBI Agent’s Sworn Testimony Contradicts Claims ICE’s Jonathan Ross Made Under Oath
news.summary: The testimony also calls into question whether Ross failed to follow his training during the incident in which he reportedly shot and killed Minnesota citizen Renee Good.

news.title: Right-Wing Influencers Have Flooded Minneapolis
news.summary: Clips from creators in Minnesota have become primary evidence in attempts by the right wing to justify ICE’s surge on American cities.
